Description: Postcard; printed paper; hand coloured monochrome photograph showing the Nebi Daniel Mosque at Alexandria.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally used. Message reads: "3-it wasn't the right thing to do, dear - but do I ever do anything right? I do think I am a cross old beggar & you must too, dear- I do hate myself for it. Then in the afternoon I had great difficulty in getting you to go to St Luke's because I had made you cross. So, dear, you see how much better off you are this year- no one to make you cross. Then you came home to tea & we all went to St Simon's in the evening. Oh! I can see it all so plainly & feel how different I...". The message continues on EPH-ME 2932.
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Nebi Daniel Mosque
